confidence_notes: No scene breakdowns were provided — the script may contain no identifiable scenes, or the input may be a planning document, treatment, or non-narrative text rather than a screenplay.
With zero scenes analyzed, all global assessments are speculative placeholders and should not be used for budgeting or scheduling decisions.
A re-analysis is strongly recommended once a full or partial screenplay is available.

top_risk_themes: Insufficient script material to assess VFX scope — risk of underestimating needs if production proceeds without a proper VFX breakdown
Potential for scope creep if creative development occurs without early VFX supervision input

hidden_cost_radar.flag: No screenplay content available for VFX analysis
hidden_cost_radar.why_it_matters: Without identifiable scenes, no VFX shots, techniques, or complexity levels can be estimated. Budgeting, vendor selection, and scheduling cannot begin meaningfully. If this document is a pre-production plan rather than a script, the actual screenplay may contain significant undiscovered VFX requirements.
mitigation_ideas: Obtain the full shooting script and re-run the VFX breakdown analysis
Engage a VFX supervisor early in development to flag potential costs during the writing phase
If the project is still in treatment/outline stage, create a VFX wish-list document to parallel creative development

for_producer: Is this document a screenplay or a planning/development document? If the latter, when is the shooting script expected?
Has any VFX budget been allocated or discussed at this stage?
Are there any known set-pieces, fantastical elements, or period/futuristic settings anticipated that would drive VFX costs?
for_vfx_supervisor: Has there been any verbal or conceptual discussion of VFX-heavy sequences that aren't yet reflected in script form?
What is the earliest point at which you can review the screenplay for a proper VFX breakdown?
for_dp_camera: Are there any known shooting format or camera decisions that would affect downstream VFX pipeline (e.g., resolution, anamorphic, IMAX, frame rate)?
for_locations_art_dept: Are any locations or sets under consideration that would require digital extension, augmentation, or full CG environment replacement?
Is there early concept art or mood boards that hint at VFX-dependent world-building?
